answerFaq1.message: The extension is a tiny piece of javascript code that can be found here that verifies the content of the websites you visit looking for badly configured links with the attribute target='_blank'.

answerFaq2.message: This attribute corresponds to a HTML option that tells the browser to open the corresponding link in a new tab instead of using the current tab.

answerFaq3.message: Main browsers currently allow a misusage of this characteristic that would allow anyone sending a link to, not only opening the link in a new tab, but also refreshing the current tab to any other arbitrary website in the background. This is an issue that can be useful when conducting phishing attacks focused on credential harvesting. In this link an expert provides a full example that shows the issue by providing a crafted link via Facebook.

questionFaq4.message: What can I do to protect me?

answerFaq4.message: First of all, awareness. The user should know that although some websites such as Instagram have already addressed this issue (by setting special attributes to this type of links including the safer <code>rel='noreferrer noopener'</code, others have not worked on that yet. This extension will let you know about how many suspicious links can be found in each website. Awareness is the best way, so if you have found that a website has not fixed this yet, contact with the administrator.
